main event: On 14th October 1959, an illuminated silver object the size of a softball was sighted at Custer AFB, Michigan by military personnel. The object was observed at a 40-degree angle azimuth of 33 degrees N/W during daylight hours.
interesting points: The object was described as the size of a softball when held at arm's length.
Military personnel and an acting project director witnessed the sighting, adding credibility to the report.
The report includes calculated and ground visual observations of the object, indicating a thorough investigation.
Despite initial speculation, the University of Michigan indicated that the object may have been a clear plastic balloon with no attached instruments.
The report also refers to the lack of any attached instruments to the object, raising questions about its nature.
result: The sighting was initially suggested to be a balloon, and the University of Michigan indicated that it may have been a clear plastic balloon with no attached instruments.
sighted object: An illuminated silver object the size of a softball
witnesses: Military personnel, including an acting project director
photographs: No, the report does not include photographs
